author: M Sharma
customer_review: TK 80 SFO to IST in business class. Best transatlantic business class product out there. Its food and service can give any European carrier's First class a run for their money. So much food and drink. Then there are airlines which don't serve even a meal when travelling First Class on a 5 hour flight because its "domestic" (eg United). They kept serving us food for the first 3 hours of the 12 hour flight. Entertainment system: Latest one not even shared publicly on the airline website. Touch screen remote which itself has a large interactive LCD screen/player works independent to the main screen! Movie choices: Amazing! Audio albums: Biggest collection I've seen. Seat is a bit narrow however very comfortable to sleep in. Amenity kits were from Cerruti. Although arrival in Istanbul was disappointing due to delayed baggage delivery. The only unfortunate thing is this is their best product and will probably not be used in Asia ever because Turkish heavily favours US destinations over others. eg. On their Delhi Flight they give out thin blankets in business from regional economy class flights. Hopefully this will change.

author: S Mehmet
customer_review: Flew 4th May from Birmingham to Izmir transfer at Istanbul. Flight out was delayed no reason given arrived in a mad panic at istanbul transfer gate with 15 minutes to spare but transfer flight to Izmir was also delayed by 1 hour no reason given. Return flight from Izmir was also delayed no reason given leaving us again in a mad dash to the transfer gate. Arrived just as they were boarding but our luggage did not transfer. Had to fill in a form at Birmingham and it was delivered to our home a day later.

author: T J Lautan
customer_review: We were flying from CGK-IST-SAO-EXE in Business Class. Staff service were of an average standard it is like they were only available when it was time to serve. Ground staff were also rude even for business class passengers. Our seat from IST-CGK the entertainment system was not working. Turkish Airlines will be our last option.

author: David Allen
customer_review: TK0033. Both flights from Houston to Istanbul were a delight. The seats were very comfortable and were nice on the new Boeing 777-300er and on the trip back on the Boeing 777-200er. Also the trip from Istanbul to Germany and back on the Airbus 321-200 were good. Entertainment system on the first but none on the way back to Istanbul. Best airline food I have experienced.
cleaned_review: tk both flights from houston to istanbul were a delight the seats were very comfortable and were nice on the new boeing -er and on the trip back on the boeing -er also the trip from istanbul to germany and back on the airbus - were good entertainment system on the first but none on the way back to istanbul best airline food i have experienced

author: K Thomsen
customer_review: LHR-SFO (return) via IST. Check-in at LHR was fast en efficient and the PrimeClass lounge was nice with a good food selection. Boarding at LHR was a bit chaotic but we got on board. First leg (LHR-IST) was a A321 with large seats in BC very comfortable for the short trip food was ok and the aircrew were friendly. IFE was an older system with 4 movie running on a loop no great but for a three hour flight it was acceptable. IST airport is very overcrowded and even the BC lounge was packed so I decided to get some sleep at the airport hotel. A little pricey but well worth it. Boarding at IST was without any BC priority boarding and extra document and security check before being bussed to the plane. While airports like the old Doha airport had this down to an art IST seems to have turned this in to organised chaos not a nice experience at all. Second leg was a B777 with a 2-3-2 configuration. I had problems seeing how this would work prior to flying by I saw both a single mum with two children and two parents with a child for whom this setup with 3 seats in the middle worked a charm. Flight crew were nice and service minded but very slow to bring food out and the chefs costume is a terrible gimmick they should drop sooner rather than later as unlike Gulf Airlines where you can discuss the meal with an actual chef and make changes to the menu at Turkish they simply take an order from the menu and that is it. Food was good and plentiful. The seat was ok for sitting and eating or lying down but getting a comfortable position to relax in the middle was very hard and took some fiddling with the limited controls. IFE offered true AVOD with a large selection of films and TV shows as well as live TV. Films were not all the latest and greatest but I think there was something for everyone. Return journey started out better than at LHR with quick and efficient check-in at SFO and boarding done in a controlled and orderly fashion. I had a quick look in the United Club lounge with was nice and quiet but had a very limited selection of food. Plane was again a B777 with a good and attentive flight crew although they seemed a bit more robotic than the previous crews. Food was excellent and plentiful although again it seemed to take quite a while to get it served. Short transit in IST where boarding descended in to a new level of chaos with absolutely no announcements no BC priority boarding and extra document checks. As a seasoned flyer I knew to just get in a queue and get on with it but a rookie flyer would have been lost in the chaos. Not good enough and this needs to be changed fairly sharpish. Again a A321 this time with a refurbished cabin which meant the IFE was true AVOD (the same system as on the B777) and nice new seats. Again a pleasant flight crew that spent forever getting food served. The food was good but we got in to LHR about 20 minutes late because we were 30 minutes late out of IST. Price considered the offering is very good as long as you accept that IST airport is old over capacity and chaotic beyond belief.

everyone return journey started out better than at lhr with quick and efficient check-in at sfo and boarding done in a controlled and orderly fashion i had a quick look in the united club lounge with was nice and quiet but had a very limited selection of food plane was again a b with a good and attentive flight crew although they seemed a bit more robotic than the previous crews food was excellent and plentiful although again it seemed to take quite a while to get it served short transit in ist where boarding descended in to a new level of chaos with absolutely no announcements no bc priority boarding and extra document checks as a seasoned flyer i knew to just get in a queue and get on with it but a rookie flyer would have been lost in the chaos not good enough and this needs to be changed fairly sharpish again a a this time with a refurbished cabin which meant the ife was true avod the same system as on the b and nice new seats again a pleasant flight crew that spent forever getting food served the food was good but we got in to lhr about minutes late because we were minutes late out of ist price considered the offering is very good as long as you accept that ist airport is old over capacity and chaotic beyond belief

author: Steve Barker
customer_review: TK 1994 / 1995 16th - 23rd May 2015. My wife and I recently flew to Istanbul with Turkish Airlines. I have to say that the whole experience from booking the flight to landing back in the UK was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful the aircraft was clean the seating excellent and the food was the best I have had outside Business Class. All in all a very good experience and excellent value for money.
cleaned_review: tk th - rd may my wife and i recently flew to istanbul with turkish airlines i have to say that the whole experience from booking the flight to landing back in the uk was excellent the staff were friendly and helpful the aircraft was clean the seating excellent and the food was the best i have had outside business class all in all a very good experience and excellent value for money

author: Samuel Sembiring
customer_review: Jakarta to Istanbul with a stopover at Singapore Changi. Check in was smooth even though Turkish didn't have a fixed check in counter in CGK. Boarding was fast and smooth. On CGK-SIN flight sandwich was served a good one with a selection of drinks. Then we have to leave the plane and reboard again one hour later at Changi. The SIN- IST leg was great the crew served properly but it lacked eye contact. They were chatting with fellow crew members while they were serving passengers. The catering service was good and the amenity case was a good looking tin pencil case which was a nice touch. The IFE was decent with a broad choice of movies and music. The return trip was in the same quality except a fair 45-60 minutes delay because of congestion at Istanbul Ataturk. My conclusion Turkish is a great choice for a long haul flight.

author: Michael Peters
customer_review: IAD-IST-BLQ and return. The plane was clean and with adequate seat pitch. Plane left Washington with only a very minor delay. Turkish delight passed out and later a hot towel service. No cocktail service. Dinner at 1.40am and it was the best airline meal I have had accompanied with great Turkish wine. I asked for and was given a refill on the wine. After coffee service and trays cleared crew came around with another drink service. Bright lights finally dimmed after 3am when it was already light outside. Global positioning system not working on this flight at least not displayed. Entertainment systems not working too well only limited number of selection. Crew passed out amenity kits normally not seen in economy. Children had their own amenity kit and a stuffed bear. After dinner a bottle of water passed out to all passengers additional water available in galley as well as snacks. Crew were friendly

author: T Hamdi
customer_review: 8 May TK 1702 STR-IST. 18 May TK 1709 IST-STR. STR-IST-STR very convenient as usual excellent food great staff. Turkish stays as my favorite airline.

author: Andrea Lemmon
customer_review: Recently flew in economy from Istanbul to Gatwick with Turkish Airlines. The flight was terrific with prompt boarding good service and on-time arrival. The highlight of the flight was the standard of food offered in economy. We were very pleasantly surprised with the quality and quantity of food and wine offered. The Turkish delight that the staff handed out was a forerunner to a really delightful meal. Would recommend this airline.

author: Helmut Hilger
customer_review: ZRH-IST-KIX and return. Plane from ZÃ¼rich to Istanbul was 4.5 hrs late missed the night flight to Osaka took the next flight 24 hrs later and the suitcase took an additional 24 hrs detour. The transportation to the hotel in Istanbul due to the flight missed was organized however the hotel was a 40 min ride across the Bosporus arriving at 4am in the morning. Okay the in-flight service was okay but would I fly TK again? Not if I can avoid it because there was no information during all these delays my online feedback afterwards produced only prefabricated and unrelated standard answers and more importantly minor delays can produce quickly a 24 hrs. delay if there is only 1 flight per 24 hrs (true not only from long distance trips!).

author: Michel Perrin
customer_review: KIX-IST-LIS. KIX-IST on an old A330-200. Check-in and boarding: perfect. Seat not 180. Very uncomfortable. Nearly impossible to sleep. Better leave it half way on a "S" position than at 140 degrees very slippery. Food (Japanese) was excellent and Gosset Champagne unforgettable. Lounge at IST very useful with nice showers but no amenities (shaving kit etc..). IST-LIS B737-800. Boarding completely chaotic no priority what so ever. Packed bus etcâ€¦ Back to the 80s. Very rude ground staff treating pax as cattle. Smooth flight nice breakfast. Wide seat.

author: Val Chorny
customer_review: Flew from JFK to Istanbul with transfer to Bologna 4/23. Flight delayed 1.5 hrs - no big deal happens. Seat cramped personal entertainment system broken. Food and drink better than average - I'll give them that. Istanbul airport is a crowded mess and the info monitors are not very informative. About 30 min before the scheduled boarding time they flash the message that our flight from Istanbul to Bologna was canceled along with > 40 other flights. No overhead announcement no airport workers in sight can explain coherently what to do or don't speak English. We later learn that a plane caught fire on landing and the runway was closed because of that. After about 6 hrs of running from one place to another and dealing with incompetent and rude employees we were fed and placed in a hotel. We were rebooked for the flight next morning but our luggage was not on it and took 3 more days for it to arrive in Italy.

author: F Bertoni
customer_review: Hong Kong to Istanbul in Business on the latest TK 777-300ER with the brand new business and economy seats. There is no more Comfort (Premium Economy) on this aircraft. It was a great flight: this new business class cabin looks extremely modern IFE has a lot of new contents and features to choose from and comes along with a new remote Emirates style very easy to use. The layout of the lavatories has also been updated and it is bigger now. Food was amazing (but this is not a news with TK). Excellent young all-male cabin crew extremely friendly and well- trained. They made me feel looked after throughout the 11 hrs flight. Again highly recommended.

author: C Scream

author: M William
customer_review: 28th April 2015 flight TK2019. Night flight domestic from Kayseri to Istanbul. Flight delayed 30 minutes. Check in was fast and efficient. Check in staff were friendly and helpful. Airbus 321 fairly full flight. Meal was a sandwich with delicious apple cake and red bean salad. Beverage service hot and cold provided. IFE not available but it was only 15 hours. Overall a nice flight for first time flying Turkish.

author: W Coenik
customer_review: Flight 71 Hong Kong to Istanbul Business class layout of 2-3-2 in a 777-300ER. This flight leaves at 11.25pm. We flew Qantas up to HK and had a 6 hour wait in HK. The first 3 hours of the flight is an eating delight. There were 2 fully decked out chefs on-board in Business class. The food presentation was just amazing. The food itself was very tasty and it just keep coming. Nothing was too much trouble. The table layout was like dining in a top restaurant and it even had an electronic candle that flickered. Breakfast was an equally excellent experience of service and taste. The seats are very roomy and quite comfortable for that long 11 hour flight and go fully flat. Ok the not so good. And it their lounge in HK. Its not their own lounge and its a shared arrangement. Its very down market and not very well appointed. To have a shower you had to book in and the next available time was 11.45pm 20 min after my flight was to leave. They really need to improve their lounge access to compete with the others as their inflight experience is excellent.

author: B Clemens
customer_review: 29/4/15 TK1530 Dusseldorf to Istanbul (Ataturk). 3/5/15 TK1527 Istanbul (Ataturk) to Dusseldorf. My husband and I flew from Dusseldorf Germany to Istanbul. On our short (3-hour) flight we were served a full meal (they even hand out menu cards beforehand!). That alone impressed me but then when I saw how nicely it was arranged/presented and how good it tasted I was blown away. I don't think I've ever 'cleared my plate' on with any previous airline meal but that happened on both flights (to and from Istanbul). There was a pillow and headphones on each seat and the in-flight movie selection was incredible - my only complaint is that there were too many movies to choose from. Very satisfied and impressed with my first experience with this airline. Would absolutely recommend it to others and would definitely fly Turkish Airlines again.

author: Anthony Pritchard
customer_review: Our recent trip to Istanbul was our first trip with Turkish Airlines and it is easy to see how you got voted "best Airline" from the very helpful service received at check-in through to the flight and flight staff the excellent food and drink provided and the genuine smiles (quite a first) we experienced from all the flight staff.

author: Nicholas Yoong
customer_review: I flew to Osaka which was a 2-legged flight with a transit at Turkey International Airport. I was fortunate enough to get good seats thanks to the staff at the check-in counter as she was very helpful and accommodating. The plane is rather dated however the facilities are still in good shape and seats are rather comfortable. The food on board was surprisingly good as well and the wine I had was pleasant. I would consider flying Turkish Airlines again if the tickets are competitively priced against other airlines.

author: M Temple
customer_review: I flew in Economy from JFK to Ankara via Istanbul on April 24 2015 and returned on May 2. My overall experience was very positive: Turkish provides superb meals on transatlantic flights and even managed a satisfying mini-meal on the short Istanbul-Ankara flight. Cabin staff were abundant friendly and present on all four flights. Ticket counter and gate personnel had a somewhat severe affect but were nonetheless very helpful. Turkish B777's are fairly new (the oldest is less than 5 years old) clean and offer very good inflight entertainment. Lavatories seemed clean throughout the flight. Economy seating is quite cramped on Turkish B777's however but not to the point of discomfort. Ataturk Airport in Istanbul is better approached as an adventure rather than as a convenience: it is prone to delays chaotic lines and overheated spaces. Allow at least 2.5 hours to transfer between international and domestic flights there.

author: Ron Kuhlmann
customer_review: SFO-IST-ADB/BJV-IST-SFO. I have not often flown TK in economy but was part of a group and that was where we sat. I was astounded by the perks that TK offers in Y. There were pillows blankets headsets and slippers at each seat. A small amenities kit was provided as well as hot towels prior to the first meal. There was also a printed menu with a choice of entrees. The legroom is a bit tight but the seat has an adjustable lumbar support and a footrest that help in adjusting position. The food was plentiful and well prepared and there was a full drinks service available. While I would have preferred to be in Business TK economy is heads above any of its competitors. The crew was friendly and attentive which also made the experience enjoyable.

author: N Hamad
customer_review: We flew from SFO-IST on April 17. The flight arrived late and so left SFO about 2 hours late making us miss our connection to Athens. Turkish put us up in a hotel provided meal voucher and transportation. They also booked us on the first TK flight to Athens the next day even though our IST-ATH-IST ticket was validated on Aegean Airlines. I will say that customer service/communication is not their strongest point but the service on the flight between SFO and IST was excellent. The food was delicious and sandwiches and snacks provided throughout the flight. The attendants were helpful and courteous and very pleasant. I would fly them again because though they have their shortcomings they are certainly tops in inflight service.

author: S Pizzey
customer_review: Flew United 80 and return 81 Manchester to Newark return for a cruise in business first seats 3 E&F on the now old 757 narrow bodied jet. Check in Manchester excellent escapes lounge Business lounge offered and a great location in T2 with hot breakfast provided. Embarkation smooth staff very attentive and polite. Pod seating a little smaller than other similar units. The inflight meal was very good only ice cream offered for seat course. Inflight TV plenty of choice and the screen the largest ever. Priority luggage first off the conveyor belt. Return flight into United Club lounge. A disgrace for a lounge. Very poor offerings and bad tempered staff at the bar. Flight same as outbound excellent. Lie flat beds very little foot space but still able to sleep and service was even better than out bound flight.

author: Mondori Atsuko
customer_review: TK 333 Baku to Istanbul. Six hours delayed without any explanation. Once it finally boarded and took off the crew never acknowledged the delay in any way just wished us a nice flight! Toward the end of the flight they announced gates for those who had not missed their connections. Never acknowledged that some of us had gave no instructions whatsoever. When I found a service desk the guy printed out my new boarding pass (for a flight the next morning) and threw it at me only when I asked did he blurt out something about going through passport control then to the hotel desk. By then it was late at night three PP control guys serving a huge crowd people starting to get angry and shout. I was afraid I would get through PP control then not get any help and be stuck outside the airport so instead I headed for the wonderful Turkish Airlines VIP lounge. There they refused to give me one of the sleeping rooms but did offer a "five star hotel" and a shuttle if I left the airport. By then it was so late that I would barely have time to get to the hotel before it would be time to return to the airport for my early flight so I hung out in the lounge all night. In all this time there was never the slightest apology for the delay or even a smile. I travel a great deal and am usually fine with different personal styles (and I love Turkey!) but this was over the top for lousy customer service.

author: Novikov Igor
customer_review: Flew from Odessa (Ukraine) to Istanbul followed by Istanbul-Shanghai jump. Flight departure from Odessa was delayed 1.5 hour without any PA announcement in that airport without any explanation or apologizes let alone there were no snacks or soft drinks offered. Need to underline that weather was simply nice clear sky and no wind. Finally making us connecting passengers running across Istanbul Ataturk Airport like Olympic champions. (Did not help our luggage however. All of us fellows from the same flight arrived to Shanghai "light weighted"). On entering boarding gate to Shanghai discovered my seat was changed but not in my favor (they put me in 38G of instead of my checked-in 14G). Again without explanation/apologizes. Was actually my first negative experience with TK given total amount of about 50 long-leg flights with them. Cabin crew meal entertainment - all was as usual. Up to the mark.

author: Luis Starr
customer_review: Done 4 flight segments in 3 weeks DMM-IST IST-FCO BCN-IST and IST-DMM. Check-in was organized and was swift given because there were not much pax on all flights problem started on the boarding it was chaotic where everyone just ran to board the plane and ground cannot enforce boarding rules like who should go first etc. There wasn't much enforcement of carry on luggage as well as most passengers bring huge bags sometimes 2-3 pieces inside the cabin and some passenger didn't have any space for their luggage to place. Flight was delayed on all flights either due to late arrival of the aircraft or the cabin needs to cleaned before passenger can board or there is no gate assigned yet. which should have been pretty standard in most airlines. Once onboard the service was a hit and miss some cabin crew were rude and with poor command of English and while some maybe 1 or 2 are eager to please cabin is as usual clean but the toilets gets filthy half through the flight. The seats are very narrow and uncomfortable I'm an average 5'8'' in height and was having difficulty moving this onboard their A321 and Boeing 737. IFE was average not much new movies and quite unresponsive the touchscreens you'll still have to use the remote. Information from the cockpit came only twice before take off and before landing. Food - their lunch and dinner are good above average servings are large plus Turkish delight is distributed prior to take off. Drinks were served frequently which was good amenity kits were given which was a plus! Landing was smooth and a plus was even with a tight connection my bags reached the destination.

author: Matthew Johnson
customer_review: We flew LGW-IST-CMB on 16/4 and being a frequent flyer and Star Alliance Gold member I can easily say that this was the worst flying experience of my life. I have never met so rude uninterested and unhelpful staff on any other airline before. To start with I was denied access to a lounge at LGW. I am aware that Star Alliance do not have a lounge there but all other airlines I have used before have given me access to contracted lounges. TK did not. First flight as relatively OK on their new B737 but seats were very uncomfortable. Then we arrived in IST and the problems started. When I went to the lounge and connected my phone to the wifi I found an email from them saying "your flight to {1} is delayed please contact {2}". I went to the lounge reception and showed them the email and they told me it's nothing to worry about. When I looked on their website though I saw that the IST-CMB flight was delayed by 5 hours. From then it took us about 3 hours in order to sort out a hotel. When the flight departed the next morning there was no mention at all by anyone as to why the flight was delayed or a single apology. 10 hours on that plane and nothing. The crew were the most unprofessional and rude cabin crew. Not interested in passenger satisfaction and not interested in safety. Their English was very poor. Overall this was a very bad experience which lasted nearly 32 hours. I will never fly with them again.
cleaned_review: we flew lgw-ist-cmb on and being a frequent flyer and star alliance gold member i can easily say that this was the worst flying experience of my life i have never met so rude uninterested and unhelpful staff on any other airline before to start with i was denied access to a lounge at lgw i am aware that star alliance do not have a lounge there but all other airlines i have used before have given me access to contracted lounges tk did not first flight as relatively ok on their new b but seats were very uncomfortable then we arrived in ist and the problems started when i went to the lounge and connected my phone to the wifi i found an email from them saying your flight to is delayed please contact i went to the lounge reception and showed them the email and they told me its nothing to worry about when i looked on their website though i saw that the ist-cmb flight was delayed by hours from then it took us about hours in order to sort out a hotel when the flight departed the next morning there was no mention at all by anyone as to why the flight was delayed or a single apology hours on that plane and nothing the crew were the most unprofessional and rude cabin crew not interested in passenger satisfaction and not interested in safety their english was very poor overall this was a very bad experience which lasted nearly hours i will never fly with them again

author: S Northcote
customer_review: First time travelling with Turkish Airlines I was very disappointed all 4 flights were late with the Doha to Istanbul being so late I missed the UK connection to Heathrow waited 7 hours for next flight no explanation was given as to why all 4 flights were delayed no apology or refreshments given. Istanbul airport is not a good place to wait for 7 hours no free wi fi toilets were dirty. Meals on the plane were good cabin crew polite and friendly.
cleaned_review: first time travelling with turkish airlines i was very disappointed all flights were late with the doha to istanbul being so late i missed the uk connection to heathrow waited hours for next flight no explanation was given as to why all flights were delayed no apology or refreshments given istanbul airport is not a good place to wait for hours no free wi fi toilets were dirty meals on the plane were good cabin crew polite and friendly

author: E Simeone
customer_review: Business class. BRU-IST-BRU. Okay Check in fast track - terrible lounge not BA anymore but SN. Planes are quite good and C cabin on short haul is very good. Food the same and boring. Crew are good and helpful. Return leg excellent check in and divine lounge in IST best in Europe to my knowledge for C class. IST boarding is even worse always a remote door even for a A330. Good lounge at Ataturk arrivals. This airport needs a new terminal!
cleaned_review: business class bru-ist-bru okay check in fast track - terrible lounge not ba anymore but sn planes are quite good and c cabin on short haul is very good food the same and boring crew are good and helpful return leg excellent check in and divine lounge in ist best in europe to my knowledge for c class ist boarding is even worse always a remote door even for a a good lounge at ataturk arrivals this airport needs a new terminal!

author: Keith Hardy
customer_review: Flew TK Istanbul (Ataturk) to Bangkok (BKK) and return. Flew Economy on the Airbus A330. Seat very narrow and little leg room for a flight of nearly 10 hours. Turkish Airlines should upgrade the aircraft used on this sector to allow more comfort to Economy passengers.
cleaned_review: flew tk istanbul ataturk to bangkok bkk and return flew economy on the airbus a seat very narrow and little leg room for a flight of nearly hours turkish airlines should upgrade the aircraft used on this sector to allow more comfort to economy passengers

author: Edward Hill
customer_review: Flew to London Heathrow from Hurghada via Istanbul. Everything started off fine. Punctual and a comfortable business class seat on what appeared to be a brand new 737-800. The problems then began with the plane landing in the "wrong" Istanbul airport. One very brief announcement from the Captain about weather and that is where the information stopped. No one on board was able to give us any information about missed connecting flights whilst we waited on the tarmac. Plane was full of connecting passengers. Plane then takes off to the correct airport. On arrival there was nobody from Turkish Airlines to process or inform customers of what to do. Eventually we found the transfer desk which had a minimum of 250 people descending on only 4 very harassed and extremely impolite ticket agents. When I finally got to the front the ticket desk agent simply stood up and walked away announcing that it was the end of his shift. Got a new pass for a plane leaving 5 hours later. Still no apology. Just thrown at me as if I should be grateful. Found the business class lounge that was also stuffed to the gunnels at the entry reception and barely a seat available in the place. Summoned to the new gate at far end of the airport. It was a full Airbus 330-300. There was a double security check leading to a seated area that was the size for a small commuter jet flight. 280 or so Passengers were rammed into each other waiting for the coach. There was no Business class fast track. On board staff were the most unfriendly bunch and seemed to have a collapse in their understanding of basic English. One seemed to really struggle with the concept of "Could I have my lunch a bit later?" Suffice to say my meal was served with no menu. I was then told that it was either Chicken or Pasta. They forgot to offer me the dessert and I had to chase them for it and was told "We will see if we have anything left." Even on disembarkation at the plane of the door they pointedly refused to say goodbye. The main hub is a complete mess and deeply unpleasant experience and the staff on board are feckless and rude. I would put this Business class experience down as the worst premium flight of my life. I fly on average 100 times per year nearly always in premium cabins. so that is saying something. Only saving grace were the seats themselves. Which have to be said on both flights were comfortable.

there was a double security check leading to a seated area that was the size for a small commuter jet flight or so passengers were rammed into each other waiting for the coach there was no business class fast track on board staff were the most unfriendly bunch and seemed to have a collapse in their understanding of basic english one seemed to really struggle with the concept of could i have my lunch a bit later suffice to say my meal was served with no menu i was then told that it was either chicken or pasta they forgot to offer me the dessert and i had to chase them for it and was told we will see if we have anything left even on disembarkation at the plane of the door they pointedly refused to say goodbye the main hub is a complete mess and deeply unpleasant experience and the staff on board are feckless and rude i would put this business class experience down as the worst premium flight of my life i fly on average times per year nearly always in premium cabins so that is saying something only saving grace were the seats themselves which have to be said on both flights were comfortable

author: M Theo
customer_review: A last minute meeting required a trip to Istanbul from Athens. The ATH-IST leg was flown on Aegean Airlines. On time morning departure from Athens clean A320 polite and professional cabin crew and plentiful breakfast. Arrival in Istanbul was the usual disorganised and rude chaos. The return flight back to ATH was with Turkish Airlines as Aegean was full. Big mistake. Delayed departure aircraft interior was dirty cabin crew were unfriendly the total opposite to Aegean food was the only positive. Shall not be recommending Turkish Airlines.
cleaned_review: a last minute meeting required a trip to istanbul from athens the ath-ist leg was flown on aegean airlines on time morning departure from athens clean a polite and professional cabin crew and plentiful breakfast arrival in istanbul was the usual disorganised and rude chaos the return flight back to ath was with turkish airlines as aegean was full big mistake delayed departure aircraft interior was dirty cabin crew were unfriendly the total opposite to aegean food was the only positive shall not be recommending turkish airlines

author: Muaz Zaman
customer_review: I flew LGW-IST-DAC and was rather surprised by the quality of Turkish Airlines. On my first flight I flew on a Boeing 737-800. Staff were polite and food was pretty good very happy that it was halal. Istanbul to Dhaka I flew on an Airbus A330-200 . Plane was clean standards were acceptable. They gave us all sorts of things like toothbrushes blindfolds and slippers etc for maximum comfort and gave the kids a Rubiks Cube and a blow up Turkish Airlines plane. Flight attendants were friendly some weren't. Entertainment was good a wide range of movies and music. Seats were comfortable with recline. There was a lot of legroom on the second flight. I look forward to flying on Turkish Airlines on my return trip.
cleaned_review: i flew lgw-ist-dac and was rather surprised by the quality of turkish airlines on my first flight i flew on a boeing - staff were polite and food was pretty good very happy that it was halal istanbul to dhaka i flew on an airbus a- plane was clean standards were acceptable they gave us all sorts of things like toothbrushes blindfolds and slippers etc for maximum comfort and gave the kids a rubiks cube and a blow up turkish airlines plane flight attendants were friendly some werent entertainment was good a wide range of movies and music seats were comfortable with recline there was a lot of legroom on the second flight i look forward to flying on turkish airlines on my return trip

author: Fotis Giannousas
customer_review: Flew Economy Class from Athens to Istanbul with a Brand new Boeing 777-300. Seat was very comfortable Cabin Crew also very friendly but ignored me when I pressed the button to call them. Food was very good for Short-Haul flights. The InFlight Entertainment was very organized and I had a huge selection of Movies and Music. Although the screen once in a while would turn off and wouldn't turn back on. There was no turbulence during the flight. I would fly Turkish Airlines again.
cleaned_review: flew economy class from athens to istanbul with a brand new boeing - seat was very comfortable cabin crew also very friendly but ignored me when i pressed the button to call them food was very good for short-haul flights the inflight entertainment was very organized and i had a huge selection of movies and music although the screen once in a while would turn off and wouldnt turn back on there was no turbulence during the flight i would fly turkish airlines again

author: Bassem Haroun
customer_review: I flew Beirut - Istanbul ground check in was ok but a little bit crowded. Food was probably the best food you can eat in an airplane. Staff were friendly but not too friendly the seats were comfortable and entertainment was nice although I would recommend less out-dated music. I found a piece of chewed chewing gum stuck on the seat in front of me which proves no professional cleaning was done. Second staff barely speak English or any other language other than Turkish but they remain friendly although it wouldn't hurt to smile more would it? Last but not least Istanbul airport is a no-go it's dirty extremely crowded and has no free wifi!

author: A Milossavlyevich
customer_review: TK1843 IST-ATH ticket bought with Aegean. 738 downgraded from 77W very comfortable old leather seats. Catering top-notch the best I have had on a short-haul flight and comparable only with Qatar. FA's proactive and kind a stark contrast with Aegean that followed. Ground staff is deplorable however check-in agents unable to speak proper English. Also Istanbul airport is a disaster: crowded dirty and without free Wi-Fi. A hit and miss experience that decreases once we take into account everything other than the flight itself.

author: Tia Elizabeth
customer_review: Recently flew from London to Osaka and Hong Kong to London via Istanbul. Some of the flight attendants were friendly some could make a bit more effort. Food was better than expected. Inflight entertainment was good with recent films were already available. Only a few mins delayed in arriving for all four legs of my flights. Only had about one hour to connect from HK to Gatwick at Istanbul the plane arrived 20-25mins late so it was a bit of a rush and I almost missed my flight. Overall having read online reviews I had very low expectation but the inflight service turned out to be a lot better than other carriers I've flown with.
cleaned_review: recently flew from london to osaka and hong kong to london via istanbul some of the flight attendants were friendly some could make a bit more effort food was better than expected inflight entertainment was good with recent films were already available only a few mins delayed in arriving for all four legs of my flights only had about one hour to connect from hk to gatwick at istanbul the plane arrived -mins late so it was a bit of a rush and i almost missed my flight overall having read online reviews i had very low expectation but the inflight service turned out to be a lot better than other carriers ive flown with

author: Bilkova Veronika
customer_review: PRG-IST and IST-PRG. My first flight with Turkish Airlines and quite a disappointment. We were about one hour late on both flights - as the air conditioning was not on it was awfully hot on the plane but no water was offered. The seats were not very comfortable and there was very little space. The flight attendants did not seem very interested in what people were doing (like playing with their mobiles and reclining the backs of their seats during the take-off). On the return flight there was a family with an infant squealing like an air raid siren sitting two rows away from me which turned the whole flight into a torture exercise. To finish on a positive note - food was very good and I appreciated having my own screen with flight information. Yet in future I will try to avoid Turkish Airlines and it is a mystery for me how they can score so well in the ratings.

author: B Borg
customer_review: OSL-IST-AGP return February/March 2015. OSL-IST on B738 aircraft. Flight more than 80% full. Cramped seating in economy. I moved to a row of 3 vacant seats were I could sleep after the meal service. The same applies for the AGP-IST sector on B738 aircraft. IST-AGP on A321-200. The aircraft seemed brand new. The flight was almost 100% full. My seat was in an emergency exit row and so the legroom was very good. The same applies for the IST-OSL sector A321-200 aircraft and seated in an emergency exit row. I had the option to travel for a slightly lower fare non-stop with Norwegian (from Gardermoen airport) or Ryanair (from another Oslo airport not Gardermoen) but I had to be at Malaga at a determined time of the day and when you factor in the luggage Turkish Airlines was then the most reasonable option. In addition the friendly and efficient staff the service standards catering in-flight entertainment and onboard comfort on Turkish Airlines (apart from seat pitch) were top notch. The duty free shopping and dining opportunities at IST airport were an added plus. I definitely recommend Turkish Airlines.

author: Modigell Christoph
customer_review: TK 1956 AMS-IST old aircraft and the so called Business Class an outdated most uncomfortable 'joke' with zero comfort. TK 0673 IST-MBA the 757 single aisle aircraft is not suitable for long haul flights and the C-Class seats compared to other airlines like KQ or KL which I frequently use on this route of poor standard and lacking comfort. Service run of the mill food mediocre and run out of choice with selection of 25ml bottled wine - very poor.

author: A Turner
customer_review: LHR-IST return. As a frequent business class passenger who has already tried British Airways Lufthansa KLM Etihad Emirates I can only say that this was definitely the worst of them all. Old and run-down seats with parts of the seat torn down and dirty. First part of the trip with newer 777 and angled lie flat but return a recliner like on a premium economy. Serving of the food and the quality more like an economy class and nothing like a business class. Flight attendants OK except one lady on the return who was rude.

author: T Thompson
customer_review: From ORD-IST and back in economy. Row 16 and 22 respectively. Our first experience with Turkish. We requested vegetarian meals and a gluten free meal for my sister we all had excellent food and even had fresh squeezed orange juice (at least on the IST-ORD leg). The seats were comfortable too with a recline and a second option to slide the seat bottom outward giving more of a natural reclined feeling allowing better sleep without cramping the person behind you! Hot towels before the meal (I still love these simple things) and Turkish delight before service. The entertainment selection was good movies could have had a better selection but the music was fantastic. From the overall comfort and food quality I was able to sleep for 5 hours on a 9.5 hour night trip. I never sleep that much in economy! I believe their aircraft's sacrifice a few of the bathrooms for food/beverage/storage. It seems the bathrooms get used a bit more though there are never lines. The flight crew kept the bathrooms cleaned several times during the journeys. I would definitely fly them again mainly from the food and comfort perspective. When you put that in comparison to the price it works out pretty well.

author: Juraj Masar
customer_review: From Houston TX to Vienna AT via Istanbul and return. I had only 1 hour for the transfer in Istanbul was told that's not enough time to catch the connection flight. That's plenty of time as you just walk a short distance to the other gate. No traveling to the other terminal needed. The flights were very pleasant by the quality of food (salmon shrimps even in economy) comfort and flight attendant service on these flights. Porcelain plates variety choice of food proper cutlery and napkins hot towels. Turkish delight at the beginning of the flight. nice menu cart plenty of drinks and sandwich any time you ask for during the flight. Just the whiskey is not the small bottle was given the glass. Staff very attentive and even transit at Istanbul was hassle-free. The ticket was like U$ 350 cheaper compare to others airlines flying to Vienna!
cleaned_review: from houston tx to vienna at via istanbul and return i had only hour for the transfer in istanbul was told thats not enough time to catch the connection flight thats plenty of time as you just walk a short distance to the other gate no traveling to the other terminal needed the flights were very pleasant by the quality of food salmon shrimps even in economy comfort and flight attendant service on these flights porcelain plates variety choice of food proper cutlery and napkins hot towels turkish delight at the beginning of the flight nice menu cart plenty of drinks and sandwich any time you ask for during the flight just the whiskey is not the small bottle was given the glass staff very attentive and even transit at istanbul was hassle-free the ticket was like u cheaper compare to others airlines flying to vienna!

author: C Anderson
customer_review: MAN-IST-CAN and return. Very pleasantly surprised by the quality of food comfort and service on these flights. Porcelain plates choice of food proper cutlery and napkins hot towels no stinting on drinks and water. Staff very attentive and even transit at Istanbul was hassle-free. What a shame they are phasing out Comfort Class as the 46" seat pitch is far better than most Premium Economy seating. Only quibble is the very high temperature at which the cabin is kept and lack of individual air control. Would recommend.

author: F Bertoni
customer_review: Guangzhou-Istanbul-Venice. Guangzhou-Istanbul: Comfort class (Premium Economy). Managed 6 hours of good sleep which is more than OK for me. As usual the seat is extremely comfortable. I recently got to know that Turkish will discontinue Comfort class product soon. That's really sad as I find it the best Premium Economy product out there on the market. The Istanbul-Venice flight was just a regular uneventful European flight.
cleaned_review: guangzhou-istanbul-venice guangzhou-istanbul comfort class premium economy managed hours of good sleep which is more than ok for me as usual the seat is extremely comfortable i recently got to know that turkish will discontinue comfort class product soon thats really sad as i find it the best premium economy product out there on the market the istanbul-venice flight was just a regular uneventful european flight

author: J Konopak
customer_review: I fly Turkish to IST from several locations in Europe in economy. The airplanes tend to be a bit older and the crew tends to be pretty much the same as most airlines have in economy. Catering pluses are the fresh orange juice and warm meal which most other airlines now forgo can't speak about the inflight entertainment because I never use it. However there is one huge negative - the online checking is a mess giving PNR or e-ticket number works maybe 10% of the time and I'm forced to go to the airport early and queue to get a boarding pass even though I don't have any luggage. This is the only Star Alliance airline where this happens to me I've checked with colleagues and they all have the same problem especially on code-share tickets. I've now started to avoid Turkish flights just for this reason as I need to waste about an hour in their huge and chaotic queues at Istanbul which also destroys any potential trip satisfaction.

author: Axelsson Sten
customer_review: GOT-IST-DAC-IST-GOT on A320 A330-200 back on A330-200 and B738 in Jan/Feb 2015. Mixed review to say the least. Flight delayed from GOT due to bad weather in IST. Middle seat turned down but otherwise standard economy seat and no IFE. Food ok. Arrived late and got a hotel night free of charge at IST since the flight to DAC was next day. Lounge at IST is wonderful and I really felt relaxed before boarding tk 713 to DAC. Old plane poor IFE poor service. The lights in the cabin were blinking all the flight and I was worried someone would get an epilepsy attack. no lie flat seat felt like a plane from the mid-90's. All in all not a pleasant business class experience. Flight back tk 714 on leased 330-200 this time a newer plane good service lie flat also a leased plane from jet airways. Plane on time and standard business trip. Once again short visit at the IST lounge which was good and flight from IST-GOT on good intra-europe business class with wide seats good service since we were only two passengers in the front.
cleaned_review: got-ist-dac-ist-got on a a- back on a- and b in janfeb mixed review to say the least flight delayed from got due to bad weather in ist middle seat turned down but otherwise standard economy seat and no ife food ok arrived late and got a hotel night free of charge at ist since the flight to dac was next day lounge at ist is wonderful and i really felt relaxed before boarding tk to dac old plane poor ife poor service the lights in the cabin were blinking all the flight and i was worried someone would get an epilepsy attack no lie flat seat felt like a plane from the mid-s all in all not a pleasant business class experience flight back tk on leased - this time a newer plane good service lie flat also a leased plane from jet airways plane on time and standard business trip once again short visit at the ist lounge which was good and flight from ist-got on good intra-europe business class with wide seats good service since we were only two passengers in the front

author: S Mark
customer_review: Boston-Istanbul-Boston in economy. Excellent fare ($600 round trip). Flights on time. Clean aircraft and seating fine for economy. Good choice of on-demand movies. Flight attendants pleasant and decent food. Recommended.
cleaned_review: boston-istanbul-boston in economy excellent fare round trip flights on time clean aircraft and seating fine for economy good choice of on-demand movies flight attendants pleasant and decent food recommended

author: M LaPrairie
customer_review: TK8 IAD-IST. Seat 5K business class. Never again. I have been flying Qatar Airways a lot lately - no comparison. Late departure from IAD. Business cabin felt crowded with narrow aisles. Service rushed. Galleys were noisy with no attempt by the crew to be at all quiet. Seat not good with confusing controls (what does MR and M+ mean in the armrest controls?). Armrests and tray table were unmovable. So what if thereâ€™s a crew member wearing a chefs hat. The food was dreadful. Dried out. Overcooked. Tasteless. Terrible seats. Economy and business class passengers all mixed up with no clear delineation between the two cabins. The lavatories are so small that I banged my elbows in the most minimal effort to change clothes. Waste bins full before we'd even pushed back from Dulles and soap dispensers nearly empty. Unreal. Felt like Aeroflot in 1970. Appetizers dried out. I asked the flight attendant what kind of soup they were serving and she didn't know. So much for pre-departure briefings for the crew. Honestly a poor show for an airline that prides itself on its food. AVOD confusing and boring. Could never find the map. The crew spent most of its time standing at the â€˜barâ€™ looking at all of us like we were monkeys in a cage. Really unbelievable. The soccer stars who are advertising for TK are all flying on private aircraft - make no mistake. If they ever took TK they soon switch to Singapore Airlines or Cathay Pacific first class. FAs walking around with their airport IDs badges hanging from their necks - what is that all about? Really disappointed with TK. For all the hype in their advertising a big letdown. Couldn't get off fast enough. Now have to endure another seven hours to DAR.

author: Castanha Miguel
customer_review: Frankly a disappointment. I flew Turkish Airlines Business Class recently: Lisbon-Istanbul Istanbul-Seoul Bangkok-Istanbul and Istanbul-Lisbon and it was the least satisfactory business class in recent years. In all flights except the Istanbul-Seoul the cabin and seats appeared run-down and old. The in-flight entertainment was limited and out-dated. The seats comfort was OK but not more than that. The service was friendly and the food was OK.

author: Marc Guillemard
customer_review: Flew from Paris to Samsum via Istambul and return in Economy. From reading previous reviews on this site and others it seems TA passengers can be separated in 2 categories: Everything went as scheduled and the performance is highly rated or something goes wrong and TA customer service is at best non-existent. Luckily I was in the 1st category. In CDG TA is in the old terminal 1 (not their fault!) which is completely outdated. Departure was a little delayed due to late arrival but we recovered most of it during the flight. Very recent A321 with IFE (choice not outstanding but OK for a 3.5 hours flight). The crew spoke good English (1 stewardess spoke French) the seat pitch is comfortable (at least 10 cms / 4 " more than AF) the food is fair both in quantity and in quality with a hot meal and a choice of drinks including wine and alcohol. A much better service than their French competitor with bus-type cabin and no IFE. The domestic flight was done on a slightly older A320 with even better seat pitch and here again crew spoke English and served some sandwich and drink. Return was of a similar standard fresh Turkish breakfast in the domestic flight good service and acceptable meal in the international flight. Istanbul airport is not at the same level but it's an other story. Safety demonstrations done in all 4 flights general condition of the aircraft's from good to excellent. Regarding this trip I believe TA is in the top league of European airlines.

author: Cizikova Barbora
customer_review: I was traveling from Washington D.C USA to Vienna Austria yesterday with a layover in Istanbul. It was a long flight however throughout the both flights I was completely satisfied with the staff service and the quality of food likewise. The flight attendants were very kind helpful and were approaching customers with a constant smile. The menu included several dishes and beverages. The portions were really big and refills of beverages were very frequent. The overall atmosphere created by the staff and nice pilot are one of the reasons I surely will travel with Turkish airlines again.

customer_review: Flight from London Heathrow to Mumbai via Istanbul Ataturk Airport. Flight was delayed an hour from London Heathrow. Overall Turkish Airlines seemed mediocre and I would avoid Turkish Airlines for future long distance flights.

author: J Vergaert
customer_review: Kuala Lumpur - Istanbul - Brussels economy. Their A330 is a bit tired but seating is decent: wide enough pitch enough good IFE without a big box under your seat compared to the much-below-standard eco seats in B777 and B787 of some "glamorous" airlines. Food is great and with my Gold Star Alliance I have access to the superb lounge of IST (just go downstairs to avoid the crowds). Same comments for flight Istanbul to Brussels. Their breakfast spinach scramble eggs is lovely.

author: A Jones
customer_review: I flew Comfort Class from IST to JFK. I've always been impressed with the service on economy class Turkish Airlines so I spent the upgrade for Comfort. I'd compare the legroom and quality of service to domestic American Airlines Business Class. It's nearly business class levels of comfort for about 20% more than economy would've cost me. The food was excellent I appreciate being given choices for my meals and drinks as well as having porcelain dishware. The entertainment selection is one of the best I've had on an airline. I first flew Turkish about 2 years ago simply because it was the cheapest option. After experiencing such great service I only fly them when I'm headed to Eastern Europe/ Middle East.

author: B Filippo
customer_review: Venice-Istanbul-Guangzhou in Business. Both flights fully booked in all classes. Venice-Istanbul: Airbus A320. Old business class configuration (3 seats with the one in the middle blocked). Limited entertainment (overhead screens). The all-male crew was nice and attentive. CIP Lounge at Ataturk Airport is amazing with two cons: a bit too overcrowded plus I found Wifi way too slow. Istanbul-Guangzhou on Boeing 777-300. Business class seat is lie- flat with a cozy sleeping set provided. Cabin crew was amazing on this flight. I am always positively surprised by Turkish Do&Co: quality is top-notch (restaurant level) and food is always served in abundance. Will keep recommend Turkish Airlines.

author: Pushap Kapoor
customer_review: We just got back to Boston from Istanbul. The new non stop service from Boston to Istanbul is great. Very good seats in economy with 2-4-2 configurations. The food is good but the host and hostesses are looks like new to the trade. But they do take good care of you if asked. Understanding their English is a problem even the announcements by pilot were difficult to understand. The ground staff in Istanbul need to learn customer service. It feels like they are doing you a favor. Very curt replies and again very poor language skills. But overall I will take Turkish again from Boston. Such comfortable seating as compared to Emirates.

author: Shane Tarr
customer_review: I have flown with Turkish Airlines three times in the past year. Once from Bangkok to Ho Chi Minh Return (suppose it qualifies as a flight) once from Bangkok to Tel Aviv via Istanbul Return and once from Bangkok to Tashkent via Istanbul Return. All flights were way above average - and I know what I am talking about because in the past 12 months I have flown on TG QF VN SQ NZ and PX on more than 50 return flights. I actually hate flying but have to fly to my place of assignment but flying Turkish Airlines is very good. Most cabin staff - male or female - are very good to excellent (several among the best I have ever dealt with) the food is very good IFE way above average and aircraft in very good condition (staff make sure toilets are always kept clean and are up there TG QF CX and NZ). My only real grip is rush rush at transit - Istanbul Airport not the best in the world although Turkish Airlines Lounge must be one of the best - and one of the A321 I flew on from Istanbul to Tashkent had several rows of non-reclining seats (mine 9C) so I must read Seat Guru more carefully in future.

author: P James
customer_review: BKK-IST-ARN on A330 and then A321. Flight from BKK late 1h arrived in IST in the midst of the snow chaos. Landed 2h late then stuck on tarmac for 1h. No gate so exit in severe snowfall and winds people in flip flops and t- shirts as this was from Thailand. Shipped on buses finally to terminal in utter chaos as all flights were cancelled. Thousands of people and only 3 TK representatives to help. Took into hotel at own cost rebooked tickets next morning via phone. Then headed for airport again flights cancelled again and no help anywhere and of course thousands of angry passengers stranded. TK head office is a place of shame that gave absolutely no help actually the sour lady just said no and then called for next in line. Result 2 days in IST from own pocket. Flying business and being star alliance gold gives little in this company when it matters. Even refused to be rebooked on other flights. Needless to say last flight IST-ARN was 1h late boarding commenced without communication between gate and crew so business passengers and others too stood 20 min outside of plane door watching crew clean the cabin and stock the food. Quite embarrassing. Was planning another flight with TK in business to BKK but my money goes from now to other carriers.

author: Xavier Bous
customer_review: The check-in and departure time are always chaotic with Turkish Airlines. I flew already 8 times with Turkish and they are usually late. Connections at Istanbul are tight which is not matching with the systematic delays of Turkish Airways. If you miss your plane the hotel is provided by Turkish Airlines but the transfer to the hotel is terrible without mentioning the terrible and unprofessional attitude from the visas service + immigration + info desks at Istanbul Airport. Globally I would not recommend Turkish Airways. Even if I omit the delay issues and even if the service on board is OK there is still this something missing that does not make me want to fly again with Turkish Airways - maybe courtesy from their staff. The only point I am impressed about is that even if Istanbul Airport seems to be an organizational chaos the luggage is usually arriving at the final destination even when the time between connection flights are tight (of course if the planes are on time).

author: J Mann
customer_review: Flew TK 1332 BRE-IST then TK 716 IST-DEL round-trip. I booked the flight quite spontaneously and TK was surprisingly cheap. Having read that TK is quite good I was a little bit disappointed. Though the food was really great (the Turkish delight is delicious and I like the idea of the fresh orange juice) and I was even given a second menu the staff disappointed me. Perhaps it was only me but I didn't feel very welcome their English wasn't always understandable. Furthermore my flight from Bremen to Istanbul was delayed by over an hour and thus getting my connection was definitely exhausting. When the plane arrived at the gate my last call had already begun. Unfortunately there was no help offered by the FAs. All in all I chose not to recommend Turkish because the onboard product is just average and I prefer airlines being held by more democratic states than Turkey. Nevertheless the flight was quite cheap but in future I will try to avoid them.

author: Rajashekar Resmi
customer_review: I flew with Turkish Airways from Munich to Dubai via Istanbul. The tickets were cheap and the service was mediocre. The food was edible but not good. We reached Istanbul a little late and had to run to catch the connection flight. The staff was rude and was blaming us telling that they were about to close the gate and we should be more responsible. Cabin staff were also late to attend to our requests. I recommend the airline if the tickets are really cheap. Else it is better to consider other middle eastern airlines that are way ahead.
cleaned_review: i flew with turkish airways from munich to dubai via istanbul the tickets were cheap and the service was mediocre the food was edible but not good we reached istanbul a little late and had to run to catch the connection flight the staff was rude and was blaming us telling that they were about to close the gate and we should be more responsible cabin staff were also late to attend to our requests i recommend the airline if the tickets are really cheap else it is better to consider other middle eastern airlines that are way ahead

author: Sanjay Modak
customer_review: Flew from DXB-IST-JFK in December 2014 and the return JFK-IST-DXB in January 2015. At check-in in DXB I requested an emergency exit seat for the IST-JFK leg. The rookie check-in agent first said nothing was available but his supervisor stopped by and found one for me. This made the long flight bearable. The flight was packed but the crew were cheerful and efficient and did everything right. Food was so-so - getting a bit weary of the standard kebabs and mystery veggies. The IFE was excellent - far better than Emirates' much touted IFE and better than QR. On the way back was checked in by a surly female agent at JFK. She couldn't find me an exit row on the A-330 to IST but said she found me a bulkhead one on the IST-DXB leg. The A330 was surprisingly comfortable much more so that the 777 even for my 6'3" frame and the young lady next to me just curled up and slept the whole way through and was no bother to me. On the home leg I found that the seat the JFK agent had got me a seat in the row behind the bulkhead! On the 777 with the seats compressed for the 'short-haul' 4 hour flight to DXB I found sitting was unbearable. I silently cursed this agent and couldn't wait to deplane and get home. Service was once again good and the scrambled eggs were fluffy and tasty. But any satisfaction I got from this was neutralized by the uncomfortable seat and the incompetence of the check-in agent at JFK. This is the second time this has happened to me. A year ago flying from AGP-IST-DOH the agent at AGP assured me she had got me an exit row and I found myself directly behind exit row in a non-reclining seat. TK has to train its check-in staff to read the seat map better. Am contemplating a trip very soon to AGP and then later to BOS and wondering whether to fly TK after these twin disasters.

author: Tibor Palencsar
customer_review: Turkish Airlines deserves to be the #1 European airlines! It treats people in the economy class like other airlines treat business class passengers. The food and drinks we received was fantastic in-flight entertainment is also great (too bad it is available only on selected flights). The only thing I can complain about is the leg space which could be a bit bigger.

author: Raymond Desjardins
customer_review: Food was below average. Inflight service below par. There was one very polite cabin stewardess unfortunately the rest of the cabin crew were very rude. I broke my headset half way through the flight and asked a male cabin crew if he could provide a new one. His response was so arrogant it was quite unbelievable.

author: L Byrne
customer_review: JFK-IST-DHA and return in Jan 15. Be advised that planes have no individual ventilation system and were unexpectedly quite warm on all segments. The planes on all segments were dirty. Leaving Istanbul in both directions the restroom had not been wiped down or restocked. There was trash in the seat pocket and in one instance on my seat! There was a marked difference in staff treatment of passengers. On US legs the staff were merely uninterested. On the Dhaka leg the flight attendants were actively rude. Though there was no noticeable turbulence on the Dhaka bound leg we were instructed to remain seated and not permitted to go the restroom for 5 hours. The lady in the seat in front of me called the attendant. Three times the attendant came by and switched off the light and left without asking the reason for the call. The fourth time the lady put out her hand and asked for a glass of water. The attendant rolled her eyes and half an hour later brought a half glass. Also delayed takeoff at Dhaka (which seems to be a hallmark of TA judging from these reviews) caused all passengers on the full flight to miss their connections for the night. The only announcement in the cabin at landing at 6pm was to list the connecting gates. But there were no flights until the next day. There was no assistance with arrangements. The lucky people who knew what to do and had money for a visa waited 3-4 hours outside the airport for a TA transfer to a hotel. Those without experience or funds wandered the airport all night looking for a helpful TA rep to no avail. Never again. I will pay the extra for Emirates.

author: H Jansen
customer_review: CPH-IST-BKK-IST-CPH. F&B offerings seating and IFE decent on all aircraft. Did not encounter one single smile on any staff on any of these 4 flights. Some of the worst I have come across. No personal touch of any kind and staff clearly not interested in their jobs. This is really a shame since hard product of TK is decent but it all falls to the ground with carelessness of passengers. Will definitely try to avoid TK as good as I can. Lounge in IST was the same feeling - never felt so unwelcome on any Airline before. Price of ticket was good but would not consider using TK Again.

author: Gregory Michaelsen
customer_review: Copenhagen-Istanbul/Istanbul-Hamburg. Overall great service left on time. Information on board given in poor English. Food and Beverages very good. Impressive Inflight entertainment system on outbound flight. Staff poor comprehension of English language.

author: R Prabhu
customer_review: I flew ORD-IST-BOM and back. Checking in and Boarding at ORD was pleasant. The ORD-IST flight left on time and they offered Turkish Delight (sweet) on board with nice touches like hot towels for the face. Istanbul airport is the worst. The gate isn't announced until just 1 hour before departure and until then there is hardly any seating whatever there is it is for patrons of the overpriced restaurants. At the gate there was no boarding plan and no announcements! Just a hoard of passengers moving towards the gate in any random order. The most intriguing factor is their double standard- flights to/from the US serve Turkish Delights and hot towels have friendly staff who speak good English. On flights to India they don't serve any welcome sweet or hot towels and the staff are rude and can barely muster up basic English. On the return trip this double standard was confirmed. Also the flights to the US connect the airport with jetways where as Indian flights have to use a bus! Flights to the US require extra screening which again is done in a totally disorganized fashion and what's more our gate changed after the screening so we had to repeat the screening at the new gate! They ask weird questions going into much more detail than US immigration ever would and make you grossly uncomfortable. Our flight was delayed almost 2 hrs out of IST due to this gate change fiasco.

author: F Bertoni
customer_review: Flight 15 Istanbul-Sao Paulo/Buenos Aires as usual operated with Boeing 777-300ER. Flew Comfort/Premium Economy class. This was the best long-haul flight I have taken. What impressed me on this flight was the cabin crew: they were smiling polite and always there. I felt sick (heavy headache) and two members regularly came to me (flight time was 13.30 hours due to bad weather conditions on the Atlantic) to check if I was feeling better or not. Food by Turkish Do&Co was as always delicious. Price paid was super. I do look forward to my next TK flight which will be in six days.
cleaned_review: flight istanbul-sao paulobuenos aires as usual operated with boeing -er flew comfortpremium economy class this was the best long-haul flight i have taken what impressed me on this flight was the cabin crew they were smiling polite and always there i felt sick heavy headache and two members regularly came to me flight time was hours due to bad weather conditions on the atlantic to check if i was feeling better or not food by turkish doco was as always delicious price paid was super i do look forward to my next tk flight which will be in six days

author: R Abdul
customer_review: I flew Economy from Istanbul to Lahore. My flight was delayed in Istanbul by 6.5 hours but no one informed us until twenty minutes after the flight was supposed to depart. Even then we had to look at the screens to tell us. Never did an airport representative bother telling us what was happening. We spent two hours walking around the airport like sheep trying to find a single dinner voucher due to the airport staffs incompetence and indifference. Every single staff member in the airport was rude and disrespectful. The one dinner we were offered was a chicken dish that tasted like plastic and was quickly discarded by all of the passengers. Will never fly with Turkish again nor through Istanbul ever again.

author: F Epple
customer_review: STR-IST-DOH TK 1706 A320 (TC-JUK). STR-IST was not as pleasant as previous TK flights: did TK reduce the seat pitch? No more height adjustable head rest no IFE not even overhead screens. Service food flying were TK standard (which is pretty good) but the narrow seat pitch will have me looking for alternatives if this should become normal. Onward flight to Doha on A321 was normal standard nice seats in seat IFE - that's TK I like.

author: Susan James
customer_review: I flew business class from Istanbul to Los Angeles my seat was 1D. This was flight TK 9. The flight was January 16 2015. It was wonderful service the best I have ever had. The food was good and served in a nice preparation. The Chef is outfitted in a nice chef outfit and gives you the impression you are in a restaurant. The menu choices were broad and adequate. We had a nice trolley of appetizers salads main dish then the deserts. Good quality and plenty of choices. I like when they offer to make up your bed. The flight attendants are attentive and are always picking up after the passengers. The movie selections were good. Always nice to have free Wi-FI. Turkish airlines have way more comfortable seats than some o the other carriers like British Airlines. I will fly them again.

author: G Penola
customer_review: Flew A321 Business class IST-LHR. Seating was economy seating that was very hard. The food and service in the cabin was excellent but was let down by the physical cabin environment. Turkish Airlines should really think hard about assigning these aircraft on flights of 4 hours. The seats are not business class and are quite uncomfortable. For the duration of the flight I sat on the pillow. Additionally there was no inflight entertainment. Turkish Airlines can do better than this. I will think carefully before choosing Business Class again on this airline if this type of aircraft is assigned.

author: G Penola
customer_review: Flew LHR-IST on 737-800 Business Class. Inflight Entertainment was OK. Seat comfort was not great and the recline angle very small on this aircraft. For a business class seat it hardly reclines to a comfortable angle for resting. I think Turkish Airlines need to reconsider their business class product on medium hall routes as their long haul business class is excellent. This was rather unsatisfactory.

author: Rustem Gode
customer_review: I took a trip from Boston to Adana in business class. I find them very hospitable service was very good. Airbus's could be newer and Istanbul Ataturk airport could be more efficient passport police were very polite. Very affordable $600 around trip can't be beat.
cleaned_review: i took a trip from boston to adana in business class i find them very hospitable service was very good airbuss could be newer and istanbul ataturk airport could be more efficient passport police were very polite very affordable around trip cant be beat

author: Mehdi Tahuri
customer_review: Travelled return trip from Montreal to Tehran with family. Had $600 deal which was great. Impressed with the number of hand outs. They hand out a bag full of slippers eye and ear covers toothbrush. They take care of kids very well too. Montreal to Istanbul flight was a newer plane. They are also not picky about a kilo or two overweight which is great. Per pay lounge in Istanbul is free for kids. For $21 you and your children can spend 6 hrs in an all you can eat snack lounge take a shower and recharge. The negatives were: They put me my wife and 3 yr old and 6 yr old daughters in completely separate seats in different rows for the 2nd leg. Istanbul airport is simply not large enough or updated enough to transit the volume of passenger its doing. I found the airport staff rude and unhelpful on a couple of occasions. I would still fly Turkish for flights that aren't via Istanbul.

author: A Goodwin
customer_review: We found it unacceptable being placed in a side room being used to re- charge batteries for electric vehicles! A large group of disabled passengers were left in this dreadful room. Only seating was non upholstered dropdown metal seats with a narrow gap between them. There was inadequate space to pass resulting in feet being stood on and legs being banged every time someone needed to pass. When we arrived in Manchester staff had forgotten to request wheelchairs. In all made to feel like third class citizens. Don't accept disabled passengers if you don't want to look after them. There was very little help for us on this airline.

author: C Cheong
customer_review: Flew back with TK 1955 business class from Istanbul to Amsterdam in a very old 319. Awful plane so old and dirty. For business class it was indeed awful - normal economy seat with no entertainment at all.
cleaned_review: flew back with tk business class from istanbul to amsterdam in a very old awful plane so old and dirty for business class it was indeed awful - normal economy seat with no entertainment at all

author: S May
customer_review: Flew JFK-MAN in late December after reading recent reviews I was very hesitant about choosing Turkish. They were the cheapest legacy airlines on this route besides the slight detour to Turkey I thought no problem. Being star gold check in at JFK was easy with no waiting was informed at check in that flight was delayed by an hour due to late arrival of previous flight. I had a 2 hour connection in Istanbul asked the check in lady whether it'll be a problem she said no problem plenty of time. Went into Lufthansa lounge as it was the better option of lounges very good quality food/drinks and very quiet. Only problem was no monitors for boarding I proceeded to boarding gate at the time on the boarding pass and there was a was slight delay. Ended boarded first aircraft was clean and in good condition A330-300. Sat in the first section of economy in window finally departed 2hours late due to traffic at JFK knew I'd be pretty lucky to make my next flight. In-flight service was great food good quality and plenty of drinks frequently. Only part I could fault was the size of the offerings was on the small side besides that FA where attentive and helped passengers in every way. I found the onboard chef a bit of a laugh with his hat and outfit but it is a good look and it's a unique product in the industry. I asked one flight attendant what was to happen with my connection when I arrived - no help just said plenty of flights to MAN daily. Arrival into IST was when my next flight was boarding I thought I might have a slight chance if gates were close arrived to a remote stand and we were bussed in. No one was there to help connecting passengers everyone had no idea where to go I eventually found the transfer desk. Was put on a flight 5 hours later no food vouchers offered or compensation or an apology. I used the 'amazing lounge' which would be great with about 50% less people the lounge was packed it was struggle to find a table or chairs. I tired to get some sleep somewhere but was unable to. Asked to use shower but there was a 4 hour wait I said ok because I had five hours got given a buzzer and waited. Finally boarded MAN flight A320 it was uneventful good in-flight entertainment staff were good but less happy than previous leg. Turkish Airlines in-flight product is very good but they really need to work on ground staff and transfers at IST after that flight I said never again purely because of the transfer.

author: J Sen
customer_review: Flights 33 and 34 round-trip from Houston to Istanbul from July 26th 2014 through August 10th 2014. They have the best food and inflight entertainment. Their Boeing 777 Cabin is new and looks very nice. They make my flight a real pleasure every time I fly with them.

author: C Cheong
